content.description: Start sitting back in the cave with the obvious left facing jug.  Climb out the roof on fun jugs, then climb left out the cave and up onto the boulder.  The moves are fun but the crux is not dabbing detracting from the quality somewhat.
content.protection: Problem is really low so easy to protect with two pads.  No spotters are required.
content.location: Once your in the Laguna Corridor this problem will be to your right (as you face the end of the corridor) and up a small slab.  Can be difficult to spot the cave until you're right on top of it.

content.description: An easier, less obvious variation to Evergreen. Start to the right of Evergreen, go up and then left to connect into Evergreen's topout.
Proudest line of this area. Highball with a committing move up top and perfect landing. Lots of sun midday.

Sit start at good holds (you'll likely sit on the exposed roots of a fallen tree). Climb up and slightly right to match on a crimp rail. Go for a big right-hand move to the flat/slightly slopey hueco. Use the arete and a right-hand pinchy side-pull to make your way to the lip, topping out near Wicicala Cave.Â
content.location: In the Laguna Corridor, just below the Wicicala Cave.

content.description: This small area only has a few problems of mostly low quality.  There are a few V7's here, a V5, 2 V3's, and a few easier problems.  In addition to this much of the year it is difficult to access without waders as the Lagoon may be filled.  However if you're in the area and looking for a lowball roof then Wicicala Cave V5 is worth a visit.
